009package Geometric_Operations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.image.ImageMapper;
015import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.nonlinear.BilinearMapping;
019
020public class Transform_Bilinear implements PlugInFilter {
021
022    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
023        return DOES_ALL;
024    }
025
026    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
027//              Point p1 = Point.create(0, 0);
028//              Point p2 = Point.create(400, 0);
029//              Point p3 = Point.create(400, 400);
030//              Point p4 = Point.create(0, 400);
031//
032//              Point q1 = Point.create(0, 60);
033//              Point q2 = Point.create(400, 20);
034//              Point q3 = Point.create(300, 400);
035//              Point q4 = Point.create(30, 200);
036                
037                Pnt2d[] P = {
038                                PntInt.from(0, 0),
039                                PntInt.from(400, 0),
040                                PntInt.from(400, 400),
041                                PntInt.from(0, 400)
042                };
043
044                Pnt2d[] Q = {
045                                PntInt.from(0, 60),
046                                PntInt.from(400, 20),
047                                 PntInt.from(300, 400),
048                                 PntInt.from(30, 200)
049                };
050                
051                // we want the inverse mapping (Q -> P, so we swap P/Q):
052                BilinearMapping imap = BilinearMapping.fromPoints(Q, P);
053                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(imap, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
054                mapper.map(ip);
055    }
056}
